p: A few studies regarding healthcare worker’s experiences following SARS CoV-1 have been reported. Healthcare workers represent a unique group of people who have experienced numerous stressful events throughout the pandemic. While there may not be a clinical psychiatric diagnosis that manifests, it is important to identify post-traumatic stress symptoms, and increased health risk behaviors such as alcohol and tobacco use [ 18]. Three years after the SARS CoV-1 outbreak in Beijing, it was found that among certain subcategories of health care workers, there were higher mean alcohol abuse/dependence symptoms [ 18]. These subcategories included men ages 36–50, lower educational levels, upper-middle level family income levels, those who worked in units with high levels of exposure, and those who had been quarantined [ 18].
